page.title: 15RENOVATION AT GRETTON,SHROPS
page.content: The Malthouse,Gretton,had been uninhabited for many years,and derelict when major restoration was undertaken during 1984/5. Originally two cottages built in local stone, each were two up two down with neither electricity nor sanitation, and water was drawn by means of a cast iron hand pump from a deep stone built well. The restoration took 6 months and involved reroofing,reflooring, replastering and redesigning inside to provide a very comfortable four bed- roomed house with 2 bathrooms and full central heating. Care was taken to preserve many of the original features-half timbered partition walls,heavily timbered ceilings and massive inglenook fireplaces,and yet incorporate all the modern services and comforts of today.
